acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.00103mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 4,012mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation exposure) value of 0.15mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 101mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)) and 18-month (mice) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)) carcinogenicity studies.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.57 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. The flash point of a reagent (purity: 98%) is 96degC (c.c.), according to some reports.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutation tests (several indices) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)), in vivo mouse somatic cell micronucleus tests  (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)) and in vivo rat chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development in rat 3-generation reproductive toxicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)) and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the available rabbit eye irritation tests, irritation reactions were found only in the conjunctiva, and the effects fully cleared up by day 3 (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)). The substance is thus considered a mild eye irritant.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of only mild irritation (the highest Draize score of 1.2), with effects fully clearing up within 6 days, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)): "The substance induced mild skin sensitization."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the available rat repeated dose toxicity studies, decreased hematocrit levels, low lymphocyte levels and high segmented cell levels were detected (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, gastrointestinal tract)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including reduced locomotor activity, tremors, back muscle fasciculation, salivation, lacrimation, splinter hemorrhage of the fundus were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
